title: Ex-FBI Director Comey Indicted for False Statements, Obstruction
snippets: Ex-FBI Director James Comey indicted on criminal charges after Trump pressured the DOJ to investigate. And, Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth calls unusual meeting of top military commanders.
Comey faces one count of making false statements and one count of obstruction of justice in connection.
The former director of the US Federal Bureau of Investigations has been accused of lying to Congress.
Comey is accused of making false statements and obstructing justice. Trump fired Comey in 2017, as he investigated the Trump 2016 presidential campaign's possible collusion with Russia.
Former FBI director James Comey indicted
In a video posted following his two-count indictment by a federal grand jury, former FBI Director James Comey says he is innocent.
President Donald Trump gloated about the filing of criminal charges against James Comey, whom he fired as FBI director in 2017, in his first White House term.

Comey is expected to surrender and have his initial appearance in federal district court today

Well, the president is awake.

Donald Trump has posted the following on his Truth Social social media network:

JAMES COMEY IS A DIRTY COP. MAKE AMERICA GREAT AGAIN!

Comey, one of Trump’s frequent targets, indicted on counts of making false statements and obstruction of a congressional proceeding

James Comey, the former FBI director and one of Donald Trump’s most frequent targets, was expected to surrender to the authorities on Friday after being indict
Comey has long been a target of President Donald Trump, who has called the former FBI director a “sick guy” who “did terrible things” at the agency.
titles: Ex-FBI Director Comey has been indicted. And, Hegseth summons military leaders
Ex-FBI Director James Comey indicted on criminal charges stemming from 2020 testimony
Why ex-FBI Director James Comey has been indicted – what it means
Former FBI Director James Comey indicted on two counts
Former FBI director James Comey indicted - Axios
Former FBI Director James Comey posts video after indictment: 'I am innocent'
Former FBI Director James Comey indicted after Trump called for charges
Ex-FBI director James Comey indicted on two charges with reports that he will surrender on Friday - US politics live
Ex-FBI director James Comey indicted on two charges as Trump pushes to prosecute political enemies
Ex-FBI Director James Comey Indicted Amid Push To Prosecute Trump Opponents
summary: Former FBI Director James Comey has been indicted by a federal grand jury on charges of making false statements and obstruction of justice. These charges are connected to his actions while investigating the Trump 2016 presidential campaign's potential collusion with Russia. President Donald Trump, who fired Comey in 2017, publicly expressed satisfaction over the indictment. The current status is that Comey faces legal proceedings for the accusations against him.

title: Trump Opposes West Bank Annexation by Israel
snippets: US President Donald Trump has publicly stated he will not allow Israel to formally annex the occupied West Bank.
US president rules out Israeli annexation of the occupied West Bank but analysts question whether he'll follow through.
US President Donald Trump said an Israeli annexation of the West Bank is "not going to happen." It comes as several Israeli ministers have pushed for the idea. DW has more.
Trump says he won't let Netanyahu annex the West Bank&nbs

British officials said they feared Trump would recognise Israeli control over the West Bank in retaliation for the UK, Australia, France and others recognising Palestine

Donald Trump has said he will not allow Israel to annex the occupied West Bank, rejecting calls from some far-right polit
After more countries recognized a Palestinian state this week, President Trump said on Thursday that he would not permit Israel to take over the territory.

Trump Says He Won’t Allow Israel to Annex the West Bank
summary: US President Donald Trump announced he will not allow the annexation of the West Bank by Israel, despite several Israeli ministers advocating for it. This statement follows the recognition of a Palestinian state by more countries.

title: Trump Announces 100% Tariffs on Imported Pharmaceuticals from Oct 1
snippets: The 100% tariff on pharmaceuticals, 25% on trucks, and 30% on furniture will come into effect on October 1.

Asian stock markets fell after US President Donald Trump announced a new wave of tariffs. He said taxes on medicines, imported kitchen cabinets and sofas were needed "for national security and other reasons."
Trump said the tariffs will go into effect on October 1, but the levy won’t apply to companies that have started building manufacturing plants in the U.S.
Drugmakers’ shares fall modestly after president exempts companies with big US investments
titles: Trump announces ‘national security’ tariffs on drugs, trucks, furniture
US: Trump's new tariffs to target drugs, furniture, trucks
Asian Pharmaceutical Stocks Slump As Trump Announces 100% Tariffs On Patented Drugs
Trump announces 100% tariffs on branded pharmaceutical products
summary: President Trump announced that starting October 1, there will be 100% tariffs on all branded or patented pharmaceutical products, except for companies that are constructing manufacturing plants in the U.S. This measure aims to encourage domestic production.

title: Trump Announces US-Led Deal With Oracle to Take Over Video App
snippets: Washington has been pushing to wrest control of the popular platform from Chinese ownership amid security concerns. Trump claims that Chinese leader Xi Jinping has approved the plan, which Beijing has not yet confirmed.
Trump signs order allowing TikTok deal to proceed  Axios

Agreement separates app from Chinese owner ByteDance and allows US investors to take 80% stake

Donald Trump signed an executive order on Thursday outlining the terms of a deal to transfer TikTok to a US owner.

Trump said he and China’s president Xi J
Trump's executive order essentially bars the attorney general or Department of Justice from enforcing that law for 120 days while the divestiture plan presented to the president is executed.
titles: Trump signs order to facilitate TikTok sale to US buyers
Trump signs order allowing TikTok deal to proceed - Axios
Trump signs executive order to transfer TikTok to US owners
Trump signs executive order to facilitate TikTok deal
summary: President Trump announced a deal for a U.S.-led consortium, with Oracle playing a significant role, to take over the video app, addressing security concerns over its Chinese ownership. Trump stated that Chinese leader Xi Jinping has approved the plan, though Beijing has yet to confirm this.

title: Amazon Settles for $2.5B Over Prime Subscription Deception Claims
snippets: <a href="https://news.google.com/rss/articles/CBMihgFBVV95cUxOVHZfNFRhbnRJcUdkQUViQWlta041LWJOYVpnYjA1SUlhMU5yNVFaRl9tR09sSTkxXzZ3S1JqeGVkZlA5Y2tnTzVXZFdpNnFPV01iaFBEV1B2Vms2Smd1YUhjX085a3F1QVljQ0o5eGdrakt0cUJjQlFMMGNiYkk3bzBXdW1YUQ?oc=5" target="_blank">How to get a refund from the Amazon Prime FTC
Amazon reaches $2.5 billion settlement over FTC's Prime lawsuit

The surprise settlement between the online retail giant and the Trump administration happened just a few days into the trial over one of Amazon’s most important businesses. Amazon is paying a steep price—and taking a big win.

The company will be required to pay a $1 billion civil penalty and provide $1.5 billion in refunds back to an estimated 35 million consumers harmed by the company's "deceptive Prime enrollment practices," the FTC says.
titles: How to get a refund from the Amazon Prime FTC settlement - Axios
Amazon reaches $2.5 billion settlement over FTC's Prime lawsuit - Axios
Why Amazon actually got off easy despite ‘historic’ $2.5 billion Prime deceptive practices settlement
Amazon to pay $2.5B in FTC settlement over ‘deceptive’ Prime tactics
summary: Amazon has agreed to a $2.5 billion settlement with federal regulators over allegations of deceptive web designs that tricked millions into unwanted Prime subscriptions and made cancellation difficult. The settlement includes a $1 billion civil penalty and $1.5 billion in consumer refunds for the estimated 35 million affected. The FTC accused Amazon of using "dark patterns" for auto-renewals and a complex cancellation process. This resolution follows a lawsuit and a Business Insider investigation into Amazon Prime's practices.

Additionally, the article outlines various compensation models for financial advisors, highlighting their advantages and disadvantages for consumers.

title: Seahawks Beat Cardinals 23-20 with Last-Second Field Goal, Move to 3-1
snippets: Seattle moves to 3-1 with a win over division-rival Arizona on "Thursday Night Football."

The Seattle Seahawks resisted a late rally by Kyler Murray and the Cardinals to beat Arizona 23-20 on Thursday night after Jason Myers made a 52-yard field goal as time expired and Sam Darnold threw for 242 yards and a touchdown.
Watch as Jason Myers nails a game-winning 52-yard field goal to lift the Seattle Seahawks over the Arizona Cardinals 23-20.
titles: Seahawks hold off feisty Cardinals' comeback attempt
Seahawks resist late rally to beat Cardinals
Seahawks’ Myers nails last-second 52-yard field goal to beat Cardinals
summary: The Seattle Seahawks improved their record to 3-1 after defeating the Arizona Cardinals 23-20 on "Thursday Night Football." The win was secured by a 52-yard field goal from Jason Myers as time expired, following a strong performance by Sam Darnold who threw for 242 yards and a touchdown. The Seahawks managed to hold off a late rally by Kyler Murray and the Cardinals to secure the victory.

  • Draw for 2026 tournament takes place on 5 December

Donald Trump has warned that he will move matches from next summer’s World Cup away from host cities he deems to be dangerous.

The US presiden

summary: President Donald Trump announced that the US will be safe for the 2026 FIFA World Cup, to be co-hosted by the US, Canada, and Mexico, with the final in New Jersey. He also warned of moving matches from cities he considers dangerous, specifically mentioning Seattle and San Francisco. The draw for the tournament is scheduled for December 5.

title: UK Launches Digital ID Scheme to Tackle Illegal Work
snippets: The scheme, provoked by heat on the government, has drawn criticism from across the political spectrum.
The Labour prime minister announced the new ID requirement amid struggling poll numbers for his party and a rising global backlash against immigrants and asylum seekers.

The United Kingdom is introducing a national digital ID scheme in an effort to crack down on illegal migrant workers. A government press release on Friday announced that the digital ID will be stored on mobile devices through the GOV.UK wallet app currently in development, and will be a mandatory re
titles: UK plans compulsory digital ID as populist pressure over immigration rises
U.K. plans mandatory digital ID to clamp down on migrants working illegally
The UK announces mandatory digital ID plans
summary: The UK government, led by the Labour prime minister, announced a national digital ID scheme aimed at curbing illegal migrant work. This decision, influenced by declining party poll numbers and global anti-immigrant sentiment, has faced criticism from various political groups. The digital IDs will be mandatory and accessible via the GOV.UK wallet app on mobile devices, as per a government press release.

title: China Launches Visa for STEM Graduates; US Doctors Seek H-1B Fee Exemption

Trump's $100K H-1B visa fee won support from tech CEOs like Sam Altman and Jensen Huang for making the visa system a straightforward transaction.

summary: China introduced a new visa for science and engineering graduates to bolster its position as a global leader in science and technology. Meanwhile, the American Medical Association and 53 other medical societies have requested the Trump administration to exempt physicians from a new $100,000 H-1B visa application fee.

title: Canada Post Cuts Mail Delivery Frequency, Sparks Nationwide Strike
snippets: The government’s previous attempts at postal service cuts were politically unpopular, but Canada Post’s dire financial situation has expedited them.
The Canadian Union of Postal Workers declared a nationwide strike in response to the announcement, calling the move an "attack on our postal service and workers."

Public Works and Procurement Minister Joël Lightbound says Canada Post will reduce the frequency of door-to-door letter mail delivery in an effort to shore up its finances. The minister announced today the federal government will accept all of the recommendations in the Industrial Inq
titles: Canada Orders Postal Service to End Door-to-Door Mail Delivery
Federal government to end door-to-door delivery in Canada Post shakeup
Canada Post set to reduce frequency of letter mail delivery: minister
summary: Canada Post, facing financial difficulties, will decrease door-to-door letter mail delivery frequency. This decision follows previous unpopular postal service cuts. The Canadian Union of Postal Workers has initiated a nationwide strike, labeling the move as an attack on postal services and workers. Public Works and Procurement Minister Joël Lightbound announced the government's acceptance of all recommendations from the Industrial Inquiry to address the situation.

title: Varsho's Grand Slam Propels Blue Jays to 6-1 Win Over Red Sox
snippets: Daulton Varsho's grand slam in the sixth inning lifted the Blue Jays over the Boston Red Sox 6-1 on Thursday night as Toronto moved one step closer to winning the American League East Division title.

The Blue Jays, in the deep end after surrendering their AL East lead, began doing the hard thing Thursday night, fighting through their frustrations at the plate until Daulton Varsho released them with a sixth-inning grand slam that keyed a 6-1 win over the Boston Red Sox.
Watch as Toronto Blue Jays outfielder Daulton Varsho delivers the biggest hit of the series against the Boston Red Sox, smashing a grand slam to break open a scoreless tie in the sixth inning.
Toronto Blue Jays left-hander Eric Lauer discusses teammate Daulton Varsho’s go-ahead grand slam in the bottom of the sixth inning against the Boston Red Sox.
titles: Varsho’s grand slam helps Blue Jays to key win
Varsho’s grand slam steadies Blue Jays in pivotal win over Red Sox
Gotta See It: Varsho’s grand slam breaks game open for Blue Jays
Lauer on Varsho’s grand slam: ‘Majestic and beautiful’
summary: Daulton Varsho hit a grand slam in the sixth inning, leading the Toronto Blue Jays to a 6-1 victory over the Boston Red Sox. This win moved Toronto closer to clinching the American League East Division title. Varsho's grand slam was pivotal in breaking a scoreless tie and overcoming the team's recent struggles.

title: Ex-PM Proposes International Oversight for Gaza, Backed by White House

The White House is backing a plan that would see Tony Blair head a temporary administration of the Gaza Strip – initially without the direct involv
titles: Tony Blair in discussions to run transitional Gaza authority

summary: The BBC reports that the former Prime Minister is involved in planning the future of Gaza, proposing an international body to oversee the area for up to five years. This plan, supported by the White House but counter to a UN-backed proposal, suggests a slower transition to Palestinian rule with Tony Blair potentially leading a temporary administration without direct involvement initially.

titles: Ukraine updates: EU states to hold talks on 'drone wall'

summary: EU countries, following Russian air incursions, are discussing proposals for an anti-drone defense system, with Ukraine participating. A press conference is expected after the meeting for updates on the plans to counter the drone threat.

Proposal aims to tackle under-achievement by white working-class children and improve schools’ focus on reading

Pupils at state schools in England will face new reading tests in an attempt to tackle under-achievement by white working-class children.

summary: The UK government has introduced new reading tests for state school pupils in England to address under-achievement among white working-class children. This move aims to enhance schools' focus on reading. However, unions have expressed concerns that these tests could increase stress for both staff and students.

title: Newcastle's Howe Poses Threat to Arsenal's Title Hopes on Super Sunday
snippets: A lot has changed at Newcastle United.  It is approaching four years since Eddie Howe took charge of his first game on the touchline against Arsenal.  Newcastle previously had an awful record against Arsenal, but Howe's team have won five of the past nine meetings and often found a way to get under
Paul Merson says Arsenal's Premier League title chances will be over if Liverpool beat Crystal Palace and the Gunners lose to Newcastle on Super Sunday this weekend.
titles: Newcastle to embrace edge of Arsenal visit
'Lose at Newcastle and title race is over for Arsenal'
summary: Eddie Howe has significantly improved Newcastle United's performance against Arsenal, winning five of the last nine meetings. title: Former Liberal Democrats Leader Menzies Campbell Dies at 84
snippets: Sir Menzies led the Liberal Democrats from 2006 to 2007 and was the MP for North East Fife at Westminster for 28 years.

Campbell was North East Fife MP for nearly three decades and was made a peer, and once held UK 100m record

Menzies Campbell, the long-serving Liberal Democrat MP who led the party for 18 months, has died aged 84, his family have said.

Lord Campbell, usually known as Ming, died in Lond
titles: Former Lib Dem leader Sir Menzies Campbell dies aged 84
Menzies Campbell, former Liberal Democrat leader, dies at 84
summary: Menzies Campbell, former leader of the Liberal Democrats and MP for North East Fife for 28 years, has died at the age of 84, according to his family. Known as Ming, he led the party from 2006 to 2007, was made a peer, and once held the UK 100m record.

title: Microsoft Fires Workers Protesting Cloud Service Use by Israeli Military
snippets: Microsoft said Israel's use of Azure to store data obtained through mass surveillance of Palestinians violated its terms

The investigation was sparked by a story in The Guardian that reported that Unit 8200, the elite Israel military intelligence unit, was using Azure cloud storage to house data on phone calls obtained through the surveillance of Palestinians in Gaza and the West Bank.
titles: Microsoft cuts Israeli military’s access to some cloud computing, AI
Microsoft cuts cloud services to Israeli military unit over Palestinian surveillance
summary: Microsoft terminated employees who protested against the company's cloud services being used by the Israeli military. This action followed an investigation revealing Israel's misuse of Microsoft products to surveil Palestinian civilians, violating service terms. Microsoft stated it does not support technology for mass civilian surveillance. The probe was initiated by a report on Israel's military intelligence unit using Azure cloud for storing surveilled Palestinian phone data.

title: Trump Announces 100% Tariffs on Pharmaceuticals, Other Goods

summary: President Donald Trump announced new tariffs, including a 100% levy on imported pharmaceuticals unless their manufacturers build factories in the U.S. The announcement, made late Thursday, also includes tariffs on heavy trucks, kitchen cabinets, and bathroom vanities.

This agreement allows federal agencies to access "Grok for Government" at a cost of $0.42 for an 18-month period, offering a competitive price point against rivals like OpenAI and Anthropic.
